kyototext:
United States

BLOC: Annex 1 Party / Umbrella Group

  • Signed the Kyoto Protocol, not ratified, largest emitter of carbon
  • Against any climate negations unless Brazil, India, China, and South Africa are legally bound to reduce emissions as well.
  • Pledged a 17% reduction in emissions by 2020 from 2005, but the bill never passed through congress
  • Against any new protocol that legally binds nations to emission limits

China

BLOC: Non-Annex 1 Party/BASIC

  • Signed the Kyoto Protocol as second largest emitter, pushing strongly for a second commitment period
  • Non-binding pledge to cut carbon emitted by 40-45% of 2005 levels by 2020
  • In favor of allowing emissions to grow more slowly than economic growth
  • In favor of pushing developed nations to collectively reduce emissions by 40% of 1990 levels by 2020
  • Wants developed nations to commit 1% of GDP annually to help developing nations combat global warming

India

BLOC: Non-Annex 1 Party /BASIC

  • Signed the Kyoto Protocol, pushing strongly for a second commitment period
    • period
  • Non-binding pledge to cut carbon production intensity by 20-25% of 2005 levels by 2050
  • Strongly opposes all legally binding cuts
  • In favor of pushing developed nations to collectively reduce emissions by 40% of 1990 levels by 2020
  • Wants developed nations to commit 1% of GDP annually to help developing nations combat global warming
  • Agrees to sign a new pact only when per capita measures are used in setting standards

Russia

BLOC: Annex 1 Party / Umbrella Group

  • Signed the Kyoto Protocol as the third largest emitter in the word
    • In favor of extending ratification and implementational deadlines
  • Non-binding pledge to cut carbon production intensity by 0% below 1990 levels
  • Strongly opposes second commitment period
  • Strongly opposes not having stricter limits and expectations from developing nations
  • Not in favor of pushing developed nations to collectively reduce emissions by 2020
  • Officially questioning the validity of global pacts to combat global warming

South Africa

BLOC: Non-Annex 1 Party /BASIC/African Group

  • Signed the Kyoto Protocol, pushing strongly for a deeper global commitment
  • Committed to an emissions trajectory that peaks at 34% below a ñBusiness as Usualî trajectory in 2020 and 40% in 2025
  • Pushing developed nations for $30 billion of fast-track funding through 2012 and to raise $100 billion annually by 2020 to help developing nations meet limits
  • In favor of pushing developed nations to collectively reduce emissions by 40% of 1990 levels by 2020
  • Primary lobbyist for the African Group of Nations

Brazil

BLOC: Non-Annex 1 Party /BASIC

  • Signed the Kyoto Protocol, pushing strongly for a deeper global commitment
  • Committed to national greenhouse gas reduction target of between 36.1% and 38.9% of projected emissions by 2020
  • Most of Brazil's emissions are calculated from increasing deforestation
  • In favor of pushing developed nations to collectively reduce emissions by 40% of 1990 levels by 2020
  • In favor of adoption of voluntary commitments made by developing countries in the form of measurable, reportable and verifiable Nationally Appropriate Mitigation Actions

Canada

BLOC: Annex 1 Party / Umbrella Group

  • Signed the Kyoto Protocol, resigned from the agreement in 2011
  • Opposed to second commitment period
  • Opposed to allowing developing nations to have non-binding emission targets and basic monitoring responsibilities
  • Pledged to reduce carbon emissions by 6% initially, but conditioned on enforcing limits over developing nations as well
  • In favor of a more inclusive agreement, and a voluntary emissions reduction target of 17 per cent below 2005 levels by 2020.

United Kingdom

BLOC: Annex 1 Party / EU

  • Signed the Kyoto Protocol as a block of 15 EU member nations, pushing strongly for a new global commitment that is legally binding
  • 15 member nations of the EU must collectively cut emissions to 20% below 1990 levels before 2020
  • The EU nations will go up to 30% reductions if other big emitters follow
  • In favor of pushing developed nations to collectively reduce emissions by 50%-80% of 1990 levels by 2050
  • In favor of a stronger new framework to be finalised by 2015 and implemented from 2020
  • The EU contributed $10 billion to fast track financing for developing nations to undertake emission reductions

Germany

BLOC: Annex 1 Party / EU

  • Signed the Kyoto Protocol as a block of 15 EU member nations, pushing strongly for a new global commitment that is legally binding
  • 15 member nations of the EU must collectively cut emissions to 20% below 1990 levels before 2020
  • The EU nations will go up to 30% reductions if other big emitters follow
  • In favor of pushing developed nations to collectively reduce emissions by 50%-80% of 1990 levels by 2050
  • In favor of a stronger new framework to be finalised by 2015 and implemented from 2020
  • The EU contributed $10 billion to fast track financing for developing nations to undertake emission reductions

France

BLOC: Annex 1 Party / EU

  • Signed the Kyoto Protocol as a block of 15 EU member nations, pushing strongly for a new global commitment that is legally binding
  • 15 member nations of the EU must collectively cut emissions to 20% below 1990 levels before 2020
  • The EU nations will go up to 30% reductions if other big emitters follow
  • In favor of pushing developed nations to collectively reduce emissions by 50%-80% of 1990 levels by 2050
  • In favor of a stronger new framework to be finalised by 2015 and implemented from 2020
  • The EU contributed $10 billion to fast track financing for developing nations to undertake emission reductions

Spain

BLOC:Annex 1 Party / EU

  • Signed the Kyoto Protocol as a block of 15 EU member nations, pushing strongly for a new global commitment that is legally binding
  • 15 member nations of the EU must collectively cut emissions to 20% below 1990 levels before 2020
  • The EU nations will go up to 30% reductions if other big emitters follow
  • In favor of pushing developed nations to collectively reduce emissions by 50%-80% of 1990 levels by 2050
  • In favor of a stronger new framework to be finalised by 2015 and implemented from 2020
  • The EU contributed $10 billion to fast track financing for developing nations to undertake emission reductions

Australia

BLOC: Annex 1 Party / Umbrella Group

  • Signed the Kyoto Protocol, ratified only in 2007
  • Extended the second commitment period of the Kyoto Protocol to 2020
  • Proposed an initial emission reduction of 60% by 2050, based on year 2000 levels but did not commit
  • Against further quantitative obligations until bigger emitters like USA and China agree to binding emission cuts
  • In favor of a more inclusive agreement, and stronger emissions reduction targets on all of the top emitters
  • Committed to limiting its greenhouse gas emissions from 2013 to 2020 with a Kyoto target of reducing emissions to 5% below 2000 levels by 2020

Japan

BLOC: Annex 1 Party / Umbrella Group

  • Signed the Kyoto Protocol
  • Opposed to second commitment period
  • Pledged to 25% reduction from 1990 levels by 2020, strongly criticised by local industies
  • Against further quantitative obligations until bigger emitters like USA and China agree to binding emission cuts
  • In favor of a more inclusive agreement, and stronger emissions reduction targets on all of the top emitters
  • Pledged to a 80% reduction in emission levels by 2050, endorses a global emissions reduction of 50% by 2050
